meanings.sent1: The new dress she bought made her feel classier than ever before.
meanings.sent2: Her friend's outfit looked much classier than hers at the party.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her cat looked classier in a bow tie than most people.
meanings.sent4: The antique furniture in the room made it feel classier, like stepping back in time.
meanings.sent5: The golden chandelier hanging from the ceiling made the ballroom look even classier.

meanings.definition: Having higher quality or status than something else.
meanings.sent1: The classier restaurant had a longer waiting list than the fast-food joint.
meanings.sent2: The classier brand of shoes lasted much longer than the cheaper ones.
meanings.sent3: He proudly showed off his classier phone, boasting about its features.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a classier version of the Mona Lisa's mysterious expression.
meanings.sent5: The classier hotel offered luxurious amenities that made the stay unforgettable.
